item.title: miaaa add a quote by Soekarno
item.description: "Apa yang sudah disepakati secara politik, jangan pernah diperdebatkan secara estetis." -- Soekarno

item.title: miaaa add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "There [is] no innocence more dangerous than the innocence of age." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: miaaa add a quote by José Saramago
item.description: "Inside us there is something that has no name, that something is what we are." -- José Saramago

item.title: miaaa add a quote by Carlos María Domínguez
item.description: "To build up a library is to create a life. It's never just a random collection of books." -- Carlos María Domínguez

item.title: miaaa add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "Memory has its own special kind. It selects, eliminates, alters, exaggerates, minimizes, glorifies, and vilifies also; but in the end it creates its own reality, its heterogeneous but usually coherent version of events; and no sane human being ever trusts someone else's version more than his own." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: miaaa add a quote by José Saramago
item.description: "Such is our need to shower blame on some distant entity when it is we who lack the courage to face up to what is there before us." -- José Saramago

item.title: miaaa add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "For the body is temporal and thought is eternal and the shimmering essence of flame is an image of thought." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: miaaa add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges
